acknowledgments.summary: This vulnerability was found during internal security testing.

notes.text:
A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco Firepower Extensible Operating System (FXOS) and NX-OS System Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to perform a command injection attack.

The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of command arguments to the CLI parser. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting crafted command arguments into a vulnerable CLI command. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands at the user's privilege level. On products that support multiple virtual device contexts (VDCs), this vulnerability could allow the attacker to execute commands at the user's privilege level outside the user's environment.

There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
This vulnerability affects the following Cisco products running Cisco FXOS or NX-OS System Software:

                                                Vulnerable Product                  Cisco Bug ID                                                                Firepower 4100 Series Next-Generation Firewall                  CSCve93880
                                              Firepower 9300 Security Appliance                  CSCve93880
                                              MDS 9000 Series Multilayer Switches                  CSCve51700
                                              Nexus 1000V Series Switches                  CSCve93864
                                              Nexus 3000 Series Switches                  CSCve51700
                                              Nexus 3500 Platform Switches                  CSCve93833
                                              Nexus 2000, 5000, 5500, 5600, and 6000 Series Switches                  CSCve93863
                                              Nexus 7000 and 7700 Series Switches                  CSCve51700
                                              Nexus 9000 Series Switches - Standalone, NX-OS mode                  CSCve51700                                              Nexus 9500 R-Series Line Cards and Fabric Modules                  CSCve51700                                              Unified Computing System Manager                  CSCve93860
For information about affected releases, consult the Cisco bug IDs listed in the preceding table and at the top of this advisory.
notes.title: Vulnerable Products

notes.text:
No other Cisco products are currently known to be affected by this vulnerability.

Cisco has confirmed that this vulnerability does not affect the following products:

Firepower 2100 Series
Nexus 9000 Series Fabric Switches in Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) mode
notes.title: Products Confirmed Not Vulnerable

notes.text: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.
notes.title: Workarounds

notes.text:
For information about fixed software releases, consult the Cisco bug IDs at the top of this advisory.

When considering software upgrades, customers are advised to regularly consult the advisories for Cisco products, which are available from the Cisco Security Advisories and Alerts page ["https://www.cisco.com/go/psirt"], to determine exposure and a complete upgrade solution.

In all cases, customers should ensure that the devices to be upgraded contain sufficient memory and confirm that current hardware and software configurations will continue to be supported properly by the new release. If the information is not clear, customers are advised to contact the Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC) or their contracted maintenance providers.
notes.title: Fixed Software

notes.text: To learn about Cisco security vulnerability disclosure policies and publications, see the Security Vulnerability Policy ["https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/resources/security_vulnerability_policy.html"]. This document also contains instructions for obtaining fixed software and receiving security vulnerability information from Cisco.
notes.title: Vulnerability Policy

notes.text: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
notes.title: Exploitation and Public Announcements

notes.text: This vulnerability was found during internal security testing.
